text:
Wesley Studi (born December 17, 1947) is a Cherokee American actor and movie producer. He was born in Cherokee County, Oklahoma. He is known for his roles of Native Americans in movies.
He has appeared in Academy Award-winning movies, such as "Dances with Wolves" (1990) and "The Last of the Mohicans" (1992), and in the Academy Award-nominated movies ' (1993) and "The New World" (2005).
He is also known for playing Sagat in "Street Fighter" (1994). In 2019, he will receive an Academy Honorary Award, becoming the first Native American actor to receive an Oscar.
